intro: Phlomoides paropamisica, commonly known as the Malagasy phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Phlomoides paropamisica is adapted to the dry, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in open woodland or grassland areas.
